humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that out of the ten lymph nodes examined, one node contained metastatic carcinoma as determined by immunohistochemistry. This corresponds to the N1 stage based on the AJCC staging system, as per New Rule 12: N1 indicates metastases in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes (No/Total). The fact that the metastases were identified using immunohistochemistry and not on H&E does not change the N stage, as the presence of metastases is what determines the N stage.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The patient's pathology report indicates that one out of ten lymph nodes examined contained metastatic carcinoma, as stated in the report: 'Total number of lymph nodes containing metastatic carcinoma by gross exam or light microscopy: One.' Additionally, there is an extra-capsular extension of the tumor. Based on these findings, the N stage for this patient is N1.
